props.name: 2079pastQuestions
props.heading: Nepal Engineering Council License Exam 2079 Chaitra
props.title: NEC License Exam 2079

setA.name: What are paracrine enzymes used for?
options: Regulation of gene expression in a single cell
setA.hint: Paracrine enzymes are signaling molecules that are secreted by cells to act on nearby cells, usually within the same tissue or organ.

setA.name: Which of the following amino acids does not posses charge?
setA.hint: Glycine is a non-polar amino acid, meaning that it has a neutral charge and is not attracted to charged molecules. In contrast, Arginine, Lysine, and Histidine are polar amino acids that possess a positive charge at physiological pH.

setA.name: Which of the following cannot be considered a neuroglial cell?
setA.hint: Satellite cells are not considered neurological cells because they are not neurons or glial cells, which are the two main types of cells found in the nervous system. Instead, satellite cells are a type of muscle cell that is involved in muscle regeneration and repair.

setA.name: Which equation is used to calculate cardiac output?
setA.hint: CO = Heart rate (HR) x Stroke volume (SV)

setA.name: Select the correct statement about the ureters.
options: Ureters contain sphincters at the entrance to the bladder to prevent the backflow of urine.
The epithelium is stratified squamous, which allows a great deal of stretch
The ureter is innervated by parasympathetic nerve endings only
The ureters are capable of peristalsis like that of the gastrointestinal tract.

setA.name: Which of the following terms best describes the mechanical deformation that occurs when a viscoelastic object is suddenly subjected to a constant stress?
setA.hint: The mechanical deformation that occurs when a viscoelastic object is suddenly subjected to constant stress is called stress relaxation. Hysteresis, creep, and fatigue are other types of mechanical deformation that can occur in viscoelastic materials, but they are not specifically related to sudden application of a constant stress.

setA.name: What aspect of the liver is difficult to replicate in the manufacturing of an artificial liver?
setA.hint: The density of hepatocytes, the main functional cells of the liver, is much higher than can be achieved in most in vitro systems . This is because the cells in the liver are packed tightly together in hepatic plates, which allows for efficient exchange of materials and metabolic waste products.

setA.name: Which of the following implant metals is most commonly used for orthopedic applications?
setA.hint: Titanium is a popular choice for orthopedic implants due to its unique combination of properties that make it well-suited for this application.

setA.name: Which of the following aspects of synthetic polymers cannot be replicated by natural polymers?
setA.hint: Both thermal stability and molecular weight distribution can be correct answers to this question, depending on the context. Natural polymers such often have a broader range of molecular weights and less precise molecular weight distribution compared to synthetic polymers. Thermal stability refers to the ability of a polymer to maintain its structure and properties when exposed to high temperatures. But at normal temperatures, the difference in  thermal stability of synthetic and natural polymer's isn't significant which makes molecular weight distribution more appropriate.

setA.name: Which of the following element is utilized in the heat vulcanization process of rubber?
setA.hint: The element utilized in the heat vulcanization process of rubber is sulfur. When sulfur is added to natural rubber and heated, it cross-links the polymer chains, making the rubber more durable and resistant to heat and wear.

setA.name: What is the term for the surface on which an enzyme is immobilized within a matrix?
setA.hint: The support matrix is typically a three-dimensional network of polymers or other materials that provide a scaffold for the immobilization of enzymes.

setA.name: In the statement "Phagocytes won't eat the pathogens unless the pathogens are nicely buttered for them",  the term 'buttered' is concerned with which of the following?
setA.hint: The term 'nicely buttered' in the statement is an analogy that describes the process of opsonization, where the coating of the pathogen with opsonins (e.g., antibodies or complement proteins) is analogous to spreading butter on bread to make it more attractive and easier to eat.

setA.name: A tilting heart valve has ___ and ___ components.
setA.hint: The circular frame of a tilting heart valve is typically made of a biocompatible metal such as titanium or stainless steel and the tilting disc is made of polymer such as pyrolytic carbon.

setA.name: Which of the following is a feature of modern total hip replacements?
setA.hint: Modular is a feature of modern total hip replacement (THR) implants. Modular THRs are made up of separate components that can be mixed and matched to better fit a patient's individual anatomy. Fixed, integrated, and flexible are not typically used to describe modern THR implants, as they do not accurately reflect the current state of THR technology.

setA.name: Which of the following is used to guide a catheter for minimally invasive surgery?
setA.hint: All of these tools can be used to guide a catheter during minimally invasive surgery, but a guide wire is specifically designed to help navigate a catheter to the target location. Endoscopes, sheaths, and probes can provide visual guidance and access to the surgical site, but a guide wire is necessary to direct the catheter through complex or tortuous anatomy.

setA.name: Which of the following categories of biological skin makes use of porcine skin to treat burns?
setA.hint: Xenografts involve using tissue from a different species, and in some cases, porcine skin can be used as a temporary covering for severe burns until the patient's own skin can be harvested for an autograft. Amniotic membrane grafts and allografts both involve using human tissue, with amniotic membranes typically being obtained from placental tissue and allografts coming from a donor of the same species. Autografts involve using a patient's own skin to cover a wound or burned area.

setA.name: Which of the following is a characteristic exhibited by intraocular lenses?
options: They are in close integration with the tissues that surround it.
They are only suitable for temporary use.
They are made of smooth biomaterials such as glass.
They are used to replace the natural lenses of the eye after a cataract surgery.
setA.hint: Intraocular lenses (IOLs) are implanted in the eye after the removal of a cataract. IOLs are not designed to integrate with tissues that surround them as this can obstruct visibility. Additionally, IOLs are not only suitable for temporary use, as they are designed to be a long-term replacement for the natural lens. Finally, IOLs are not typically made of glass, but rather are made of materials such as silicone or acrylic.

setA.name: If a tissue is able to repair itself, then such approach is known as
setA.hint: Regenerative approach is a field of tissue engineering that focuses on harnessing the body's own regenerative capabilities to repair or replace damaged tissue. This can involve using stem cells, growth factors, or other biomaterials to stimulate the body's natural healing processes and promote tissue regeneration.

setA.name: What will be the affect of increasing the number of electrons emitted from the cathode to the anode in an X-ray tube?
options: The wavelength of the X-rays produced will decrease.
The intensity of the X-rays produced will increase.
The duration of X-ray exposure will decrease.
The penetration power of the X-ray produced will increase
setA.hint: Increasing the number of electrons emitted from the cathode to the anode in an X-ray tube will increase the intensity of the X-rays produced. This is because the number of electrons reaching the anode and interacting with the target material will increase, leading to a greater number of X-rays being produced.

setA.name: Which of the following is a feature of second generation CT scanners?
setA.hint: Second generation CT scanners can image head and body. The scan time of second generation CT scanners is typically longer than 5 minutes and pencil beam is a feature of first generation CT scanners.

setA.name: Which of the following can be increased to improve the SNR in an MRI?
setA.hint: The gradient strength can be increased to improve the SNR in an MRI. Repetition time, flip angle, and echo time may affect image contrast and resolution, but they do not directly impact the SNR. Repetition time determines the time between consecutive excitation pulses, flip angle controls the degree of magnetization flip and echo time determines the time between excitation pulse and the detection of the MRI signal.

setA.name: Which of the following is not a biological effect of ultrasound?
setA.hint: Ultrasound is a type of mechanical wave that propagates through a medium and not an electromagnetic wave.

setA.name: What is the number of gray shades that appear in a radiograph called?
setA.hint: The number of gray shades that appear in a radiograph is called dynamic range. Spatial resolution refers to the ability to distinguish between small structures in an image, such as tiny features or details. Contrast, on the other hand, refers to the difference in brightness or density between different areas of an image. Spatial frequency is a measure of the number of cycles of a repeating pattern that are present in a given unit of space.

setA.name: Which of the following is a feature of PET and SPECT?
options: They do not require imaging dyes
Can be used to visualize metabolic functions
Do not involve exposure to ionizing radiation
Can be used to produce more detailed image
setA.hint: PET and SPECT can be used to visualize metabolic functions such as glucose uptake, blood flow, and neurotransmitter activity.

setA.name: Which of the following physiological variables may be measured with a thermistor?
setA.hint: A thermistor can measure changes in temperature that occur with each breath, allowing for the calculation of respiration rate in a non-invasive fashion and can be easily performed in a clinical setting.

setA.name: Monitor which is placed at the bedside for monitoring cardiac functions of a patient is known as
setA.hint: Cardiac monitor is specifically designed to measure and display information related to heart's activity.

setA.name: A pacemaker and a cell phone may communicate via.
setA.hint: Bluetooth technology allows wireless communication between electronic devices over short distances, making it a suitable method for communication between a pacemaker and a cell phone.

setA.name: If total oxygen content in artery is 150 ml/L and mixed venous concentration of oxygen is 110 ml/L and the amount of absorbed oxygen in 280 ml/min, what will be the cardiac output?
setA.hint: Fick's principle: CO = (Oxygen consumption) / (Arterial oxygen content - Venous oxygen content)

setA.name: The centrifugal force of a centrifuge depends upon angular velocity and which of the following?
options: Mass of the object being centrifuged.
setA.hint: The magnitude of the centrifugal force is directly proportional to the square of the angular velocity and the radius of the rotor.

setA.name: What is the normal intesity range used in pure tone audiometers?
setA.hint: Pure tone audiometers typically use a normal intensity range of 0 dB to 100 dB.

setA.name: Cardioverter differs from pacemakers in which of the following aspects?
options: Cardioverters are larger in size than pacemakers.
Cardioverter are implanted in the chest, while pacemakers are worn externally.
Pacemakers provide a smaller electrical impulse than cardioverters.
Cardioverters are powered by a battery, while pacemakers are powered by body heat.
setA.hint: Cardioverters differ from pacemakers in that they provide a larger electrical impulse than pacemakers. Cardioverters are used to convert abnormal heart rhythms back to a normal rhythm, while pacemakers are used to regulate the heart rate and rhythm by sending small electrical impulses to the heart

setA.name: Which of the following compounds absorbs maximum CO\(_2\) laser?
setA.hint: Out of the given options, water is the most effective absorber of CO2 laser, followed by melanin and blood. Bone is a poor absorber of CO2 laser, which makes it less suitable for laser surgery.

setA.name: Among the following options, which has the ability to heat the largest tissue surface area?
setA.hint: Shortwave diathermy uses high-frequency electromagnetic energy to generate heat deep inside the body, which can effectively treat a large area of tissue at once. This is achieved by using large applicator heads or multiple applicator heads, which can cover a large surface area. In contrast, plug-in heat packs and thermal ultrasound are typically used for localized heating of smaller areas.

setA.name: Which of the following kind of membranes does modern dialyzers use?
setA.hint: Modern dialyzers typically use hollow fiber membranes.

setA.name: In case of oxygen failure in an anesthesia machine, the oxygen valve is blocked to prevent the back flow of which of the following?
setA.hint: In the event of oxygen failure in an anesthesia machine, the oxygen valve is blocked to prevent the back flow of nitrous oxide. This is because nitrous oxide is typically used as an anesthetic gas in combination with oxygen. If the oxygen supply were to fail, there would be a risk of hypoxia (oxygen deprivation) if nitrous oxide continued to flow. By blocking the oxygen valve, the anesthesia machine prevents the backflow of nitrous oxide into the oxygen supply line, reducing the risk of hypoxia.

setA.name: Which of the following safety measures can be taken for patient safety regarding leakage current?
options: Reducing the ground resistance to zero
Exposing the equipment to strong electromagnetic fields
setA.hint: Reducing the ground resistance to zero or exposing the equipment to strong electromagnetic fields is not a safe measure and can actually increase the risk of electrical shock. And although, changing the entire equipment is correct it isn't exactly economical so increasing the insulation is the most appropriate answer.

setA.name: The knee voltage of a germanium diode is
setA.hint: The knee voltage of a germanium diode is approximately 0.3 volts and that of silicone diode is 0.7 volts.

setA.name: What does Colpitt's oscillator use for signal generation?
setA.hint: Colpitt's oscillator is a type of LC oscillator that employs an LC resonant tank circuit to produce a sinusoidal waveform.

setA.name: In which of the following applications are 3-phase 4 wire systems used?
setA.hint: 3-phase 4 wire systems can be used in both primary and secondary distribution applications, depending on the specific requirements of the system. However, they are more commonly used in secondary distribution. Primary transmission and secondary transmission systems typically use higher voltage levels and different configurations, such as 3-phase 3 wire or 1-phase 2 wire, depending on the specific application.

setA.name: A zener diode is commonly used as a
setA.hint: A zener diode is a special type of diode that is designed to operate in the reverse breakdown region of the diode's characteristic curve. When the reverse voltage applied to the zener diode exceeds the zener voltage, the diode starts conducting and maintains a nearly constant voltage drop across its terminals. This property of the zener diode makes it useful as a voltage regulator in electronic circuits to provide a constant DC voltage output even when the input voltage varies.

setA.name: If a 100 Coulombs charge flows through a conductor for 2 seconds, then the magnitude of current produced in the conductor is equal to
setA.hint: Current (A) = Charge (C) / Time (S)

setA.name: Two generators are connected in parallel for
setA.hint: Two generators are typically connected in parallel to supply power to large AC loads. This is because large AC loads require high power, and a single generator may not be able to meet the demand alone. By connecting multiple generators in parallel, their power outputs are combined, increasing the overall power capacity of the system. In this way, the generators can work together to supply the large AC loads with the necessary power. It cannot be large DC loads because DC loads are supplied by batterires or inverters not generators.

setA.name: Identify the universal logic gate from the following options.
setA.hint: NAND is a universal gate. AND and OR are basic logic gates and XOR is a derived gate.

setA.name: How many select lines are there in an 8 to 1 MUX?
setA.hint: In a Multiplexer (MUX), the number of select lines determines the number of input lines and output lines. In an 8-to-1 MUX, there are eight input lines and one output line. The three select lines determine which of the eight input lines is connected to the output line.

setA.name: What is a JK flip flop used to realize when J=K?
setA.hint: When J=K=0, the output state of a JK flip-flop does not change and what J=K=1, the output state is reversed. Effectively, creating a toggle function like the T flip-flop does.

setA.name: Which of the following statements is true about PROM?
options: PROM can be programmed unlimited number of times.
Programming a PROM requires UV radiation.
PROM can only be programmed by the user once.
PROM is programmed at the time of manufacture.
setA.hint: PROM stands for Programmable Read-Only Memory and is manufactured in an empty state and then programmed later using a PROM programmer.

setA.name: What is a transmission without a start bit, a stop bit or a parity bit in serial communication called?
setA.hint: In serial communication, continuous transmission refers to a method of transmitting data where there are no start or stop bits, and no parity bit. Instead, data is sent continuously, with each bit being immediately followed by the next bit. This method of transmission is often used for high-speed data transfer and is more efficient than other methods that require start and stop bits.

setA.name: What is another term that can be used for band stop filter?
setA.hint: Snubber is used to supress voltage spikes in electrical circuits. A band select or a low pass filter allows frequencies of a range to pass through while attenuating others. A band stop or a notch filter attenuates frequencies of a range while allows others to pass.

setA.name: How can the location of poles be adjusted to improve the transient response of a control system?
options: By moving poles closer to the imaginary axis
By moving poles farther from the imaginary axis
By moving poles towards the right half of the complex plane
By moving poles towards the origin
setA.hint: To improve the transient response of a control system, the location of poles should be adjusted. Moving the poles closer to the imaginary axis helps in reducing the settling time and overshoot, resulting in a faster and more stable response. This is typically achieved by modifying the controller or system parameters to adjust the pole positions.

setA.name: In a parallel RLC circuit, the electrical voltage (E) is analogous to which of the following component in a mechanical system?
setA.hint: The electrical voltage in a parallel RLC circuit and the force in a mechanical system are analogous because they both represent the driving factors that cause the system to operate.

setA.name: The output of a system represented by the transfer function \( \displaystyle \frac{1}{1+\omega^2} \) is
setA.hint: The transfer function of the system is 1/(1 + ω^2). This is a second-order system with a single pole at ω = j and no zeros.

setA.name: The nature of a parabolic antenna's transmission line is
setA.hint: The transmission line of a parabolic antenna is a type of coaxial cable that connects the antenna to the receiver or transmitter. The transmission line is typically unidirectional, meaning that it carries signals in one direction only, from the transmitter to the antenna or from the antenna to the receiver.

setA.name: The maximum efficiency of an AM wave is
setA.hint: In AM (Amplitude Modulation) wave, the amplitude of the carrier wave is varied in proportion to the instantaneous amplitude of the modulating signal (message signal) to transmit information. The modulating signal carries the information, but it also results in the carrier wave's power getting wasted in transmitting the sidebands. As a result, the maximum efficiency of an AM wave is limited to one-third or 33.33%.

setA.name: Which of the following transforms a continuous time signal into a discrete time signal?
setA.hint: Sampling is a process where the continuous time signal is measured or "sampled" at a fixed rate or interval, resulting in a sequence of discrete values. Filtering, quantization, and encoding are subsequent processes that are typically performed on the sampled signal to reduce noise, improve accuracy, and compress the data for storage or transmission.

setA.name: Which of the following in an enlarging scale?
setA.hint: A X:Y scale means that Y is the actual measurements of an object and X is the measurement used to represent it. So if the actual measurement of an object is 1 unit then 5:1 means that the object appears five times larger than its original size in the sheet, which makes 5:1 the enlarging scale. 1:10, 1:100, 1:5 are reducing scales.

setA.name: If the annual worth of a project is 9000 at a 10% discount rate, what will be it's capitalized value?
setA.hint: Capitalized Value = Annual Worth / Discount Rate

setA.name: A chart showing the key events within the duration of a project is called
setA.hint: A chart showing the key events within the duration of a project is called a milestone chart. It is a graphical representation that illustrates the significant events or milestones of a project in chronological order.

setA.name: Which of the following risks is beyond a firm's control?
setA.hint: Market risks are beyond a firm's control. These risks are caused by external factors such as changes in the economy, political instability, and shifts in consumer preferences or behavior

setA.name: Which of the following is a key component of professional ethics in engineering?
setA.hint: Honesty and integrity are key components of professional ethics in engineering because they form the foundation for responsible and ethical behavior. Engineers are expected to act honestly, truthfully, and with integrity in their professional practices.

setA.name: The tenure of members of Nepal Engineering Council is
setA.hint: The tenure of members of NEC is 4 years.

setB.name: Ornithine cycle is recognized for formation of which of the following compounds?
setB.hint: The ornithine cycle, also known as the urea cycle, is a metabolic pathway in which nitrogenous waste, in the form of ammonia, is converted into urea for excretion from the body. This cycle takes place primarily in the liver and involves a series of biochemical reactions that ultimately result in the conversion of ammonia to urea.

setB.name: The 40nm gap when a new bone is being formed is filled with
setB.hint: The 40nm gap during new bone formation is filled with Ca\(^{2+}\) ions to form hydroxyapatite crystals, which are the mineral component of bone tissue. These crystals provide the bone with its strength and rigidity.

setB.name: The contact angle associated with water for a hydrophobic material is
setB.hint: The contact angle is the angle at which a liquid meets a solid surface. In the case of a hydrophobic material (one that repels water), the contact angle of water on the surface of the material is greater than 90 degrees, and typically around 120 degrees

setB.name: What does the following picture represent?
Which biomaterial amongst the following is best suited for craniomaxillofacial reconstruction implants?
setB.hint: Ceramics are best suited for cranio-maxillary implants due to their biocompatibility, durability, and ability to mimic the properties of natural bone.

setB.name: Which of the following biomaterials is used in IOL?
setB.hint: PMMA and silicone are the most commonly used materials for intraocular lenses (IOLs), with PMMA being used more frequently in developing countries.

setB.name: Which of the following factors influence slice thickness?
options: Slice-select gradient slope and transmit bandwidth
setB.hint: The slice-select gradient slope determines the spatial extent of the slice and is responsible for selecting a specific slice location. The amplitude and duration of the gradient affect the slice thickness. The transmit bandwidth determines the range of frequencies that are excited by the radio frequency (RF) pulse, which can affect the slice thickness. A larger transmit bandwidth can result in a thicker slice. Phase encoding slope is a factor that determines the spatial resolution in the phase-encoding direction, but it does not directly influence the slice thickness.

setB.name: Which of the following radio isotopes does not emit positron?
setB.hint: Isotopes which undergo this decay and thereby emit positrons include: oxygen-15, fluorine-18, rubidium-82, carbon-11 but not carbon-14.

setB.name: If the anatomical dead space is 150 ml, the respiration rate is 12 cycles per minute, and the tidal volume is 500 ml, then the aerobic ventilation must be
setB.hint: Effective ventilation = (Tidal volume - Dead space) x Respiratory rate

setB.name: What is the measurement range of an EMG wave?
setB.hint: The electrical activity is measured in microvolts (μV) and represents the motor unit activity of the muscle. The typical range of EMG amplitude for resting muscle is 0-100 μV.

setB.name: The SA node is called the natural pacemaker of the heart because
options: It initiates the heartbeat and sets the rhythm
It has very high sympathetic innervations
It is located in the left ventricle
It is made of natural fibers
setB.hint: The SA (sinoatrial) node is called the natural pacemaker of the heart because it initiates the heartbeat and sets the rhythm of the heart. It is located in the right atrium of the heart and is responsible for generating the electrical impulses that stimulate the heart to contract and pump blood throughout the body.

setB.name: If the AV node fails to produce impulses, which of the following widens in an ECG reading?
setB.hint: The P wave represents atrial depolarization and the T wave represents ventricular repolarization, so they are not directly affected by the AV node. The QRS complex represents ventricular depolarization and is affected by the delay or blockage of impulses from the AV node to the ventricles. Therefore, if the AV node fails to produce impulses, the duration of the QRS complex will widen.

setB.name: For best operation of BJT, which region must the operating point be set at?
setB.hint: In the active region, the transistor operates as an amplifier, and the output signal faithfully reproduces the input signal. In this region, both the base-emitter junction and the collector-base junction are forward-biased, and the transistor is able to amplify small signals with high linearity.

setB.name: The resistivity of a dynamic diode is dependent on
options: The direction of the applied voltage
The thickness of the depletion region
setB.hint: The resistivity of a dynamic diode is dependent on the thickness of the depletion region. The depletion region is the region where there are no mobile charge carriers due to the introduction of impurities into the diode material.

setB.name: Which of the following represents the nature of a circuit in the diagram below?
setB.hint: The above figure represents an active low pass filter.

setB.name: Which of the following can be used to realize an XOR gate?
setB.hint: An XOR (exclusive OR) gate can be realized using a combination of AND, OR, and NOT gates. One possible way to implement an XOR gate is by using two input signals (A and B) and combining them with two AND gates, then combining the outputs of the AND gates with an OR gate, and finally inverting the output of the OR gate with a NOT gate.

setB.name: The overall transfer function from block digram reduction for cascaded blocks is
setB.hint: Gain of block get multiplied when they are cascaded where cascaded means that the blocks are in series combination with no summer in between.

setB.name: Find the Nyquist frequency for \( x(t) = 5 \cos(200\pi t) + 5 \cos(300\pi t) + 5 \cos(400\pi t)+ 5 \cos(500\pi t) \).
setB.hint: The sampling frequency should be greater than or equal to twice the bandwidth of the signal.

setB.name: What is the maximum intake of students engineering colleges in Nepal as per NEC Act 2078?
How does engineering differ from pure science?
options: Engineering focuses on theoretical research, while pure science is more practical.
Engineering applies scientific principles to design and create useful products and systems.
Engineering is primarily concerned with environmental preservation, while pure science focuses on exploration
Engineering only involves building physical structures, while pure science deals with abstract concepts.
setB.hint: While both engineering and pure science involve the application of scientific knowledge, they differ in their objectives and approaches. Engineering utilizes scientific principles to develop practical solutions and create useful products, systems, and technologies. It focuses on the design, construction, and implementation of solutions to real-world problems. In contrast, pure science is more concerned with the pursuit of knowledge and understanding fundamental scientific concepts through observation, experimentation, and theoretical research. Pure science aims to expand scientific knowledge without necessarily having direct practical applications in mind.

pass: Wow, you passed! Are you sure you're not cheating?
I'd be impressed if you weren't such a sore winner. Just kidding, congrats!
I'll let you have this win as long as you promise to buy me a drink.
You must have cheated because there's no way you passed fairly.
You're welcome for the pity points
fail: Oopsie daisy, looks like you missed the mark
A for effort, F for execution
I think the universe is telling you to stick to your day job
Looks like your crystal ball needs a polish
That was almost impressive, in a not-at-all impressive kind of way.
Looks like you're not quite ready for the big leagues yet
Well, that didn't go as planned
Uh-oh, you'll have to try again
You're doing great... if your goal is to fail
I'm not saying you're bad, but...
This quiz was just a warm-up, right?
Let's hope you don't loose sleep over this one.
You're not bad... you're just not good enough.
Don't worry, it's just a quiz... or is it?
Not quite the result we were hoping for!

faq.question: What is the source for the content of the quizzes?
faq.answer: The content of the quizzes included in this site is based on the input and recollection of individuals who have taken the exam.

faq.question: Is the authenticity of the quizzes verified?
How can I contribute?
faq.answer: If you are someone who's appeared in the license exam, you can help by posting questions. See contact information at the bottom of this page.
